metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: Associate Director, Compensation
content:
Our Opportunity:
Chewy is seeking an Associate Director, Compensation in our Boston, MA location. The position, reporting to the Director, Compensation, will lead the team managing compensation for Human Resources, Marketing, Finance, Tech, and Healthcare, and overall compensation administration. The Associate Director requires a balance between strategic, best practice expertise and current hands-on experience. The role requires strong analytical skills in addition to the ability to partner with and influence business leadership.
What You’ll Do:

Engage and partner across Human Resources to ensure compensation administration and processes are aligned with HR objectives.
Provide consultation and partnership to identify how compensation can support business needs and priorities.
Lead, develop, and manage a team of compensation managers to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Oversee Workday compensation modules, continual improvements, and optimization of Workday capabilities for maximum productivity.
Build repeatable and scalable solutions.
Think strategically and objectively; effectively translate data into actionable insights and strategies.

What You’ll Need:

7+ years of experience, preferably in a fast-paced changing environment
3+ years of experience regularly interfacing and communicating with executive leaders up to the C-suite. 
Proven track record of utilizing a data-driven approach to building and innovating 
Extensive knowledge of compensation practices
Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to interact with multiple stakeholders across the organization.
A collaborative work style that can influence peers, subordinates, and management cross-functionally
Bachelor’s Degree 
Proficient in Workday, SNOW, PowerPoint, and Excel.
Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

questions.label: Internal purposes only - no need to answer *
Arbitration Agreement Signed?
Arbitration Agreement Signed Date

Deloitte is Chewy’s independent auditor. To not impair Deloitte's independence, Chewy must validate the role of any current or former Deloitte employee against any exempt role they are interviewing for at Chewy. Do you currently work for Deloitte or have you ever been employed by Deloitte in the past?

Close family ties to a Deloitte employee could also impair Deloitte’s independence as Chewy’s auditor should you become employed by Chewy.  Do you have a close family member (spouse or equivalent, parent, dependent, non-dependent child, and/or sibling) that currently works for Deloitte?
